textRuns.value: To classify customer default risk, we implemented a logistic regression model trained on key financial and demographic predictors, including interest rate, loan-to-income ratio, age, employment length, loan purpose, residential status, and historic default history. Categorical variables were encoded to ensure compatibility with the model, and a custom classification threshold of 0.35 was applied to balance precision and recall. The model outputs a risk score representing the probability of default, which is then used to flag high-risk accounts. Performance metrics accuracy, precision, recall, and AUC were calculated to evaluate the modelâ€™s effectiveness, providing a robust foundation for risk segmentation and decision-making.
